xes

Class XESEventWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • xes.XESEventWriter

  • public class XESEventWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods for writing the events formatted according to XES standard to the file.

    Note 1: the new line character is not shown anywhere in the strings as it was implemented in the XESFormatter.addKey(String, String, String) method.

    Note 2: the XESFormatter.addTabs(int) is used to indent the lines accordingly.

    See Also:
    XESFormatter.addKey(String, String, String), XESFormatter.addTabs(int)

      • XESEventWriter

        public XESEventWriter()

    • Method Detail

      • writeEvent

        public static void writeEvent(java.io.FileWriter fwrite)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the event and its attributes to the file.

        In XES, an event is contained between the <event> and the </event> tags. These tags are added with the XESFormatter.beginEvent() and XESFormatter.endEvent() methods. Within these tags, the keys containing various data about the event are added.

        Only three keys are mandatory for creating an event log, which are the event id, the time stamp and the activity name. However, the instance id, scope id and event life cycle state where added in order to provide as much information as could be extracted.

        Refer to Event for the definitions of the aforementioned variables.

        Parameters:
        fwrite - the File Writer in use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if string cannot be written to file
        See Also:
        XESFormatter.beginEvent(), XESFormatter.endEvent()

      • writeTrace

        public static void writeTrace(java.io.FileWriter fwrite,
                              java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.sql.SQLException
        When a new process instance is detected, a new <trace> tag needs to be opened and a key is added in order to be traced. This is accomplished by using the XESFormatter.beginTrace() method and the XESFormatter.addKey(String, String, String) method which adds the instanceId key, as that is the value that tells us that a new set of events is coming for the specific process instance.
        Parameters:
        fwrite - the File Writer in use
        rs - the result set in use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if string cannot be written to file
        java.sql.SQLException - if cannot retrieve result set

      • closeTrace

        public static void closeTrace(java.io.FileWriter fwrite)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the </trace> tag with the XESFormatter.endTrace() method.
        Parameters:
        fwrite - the File Writer in use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if string cannot be written to file
